member.name: M:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.XamTilesControl.IsContainerCompatibleWithItem(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if a container can be reused for a specific item.
member.param: The container to be reused.
The potential new item.
member.returns: True if the container can be reused for the item

remarks.para: When looking for a suitable container for an item the generator will search its cache and call this method to see if one of its cached containers is compatible with the item. If this method returns true then the container is assigned to the item and the method is called.
Note: the default implementation always returns true.

member.returns: True if the specified item is its own container.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.XamTilesControl.Theme
member.summary: Gets/sets the default look for the control.

remarks.para: If left set to null then the default 'Generic' theme will be used. This property can be set to the name of any registered theme (see and methods).

The following themes are pre-registered by this assembly but additional themes can be registered as well.
"Aero" - a theme that is compatible with Vista's 'Aero' theme.
"Generic" - the default theme.
"LunaNormal" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'blue' theme.
"LunaOlive" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'olive' theme.
"LunaSilver" - a theme that is compatible with XP's 'silver' theme.
"Office2k7Black" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Black' theme.
"Office2k7Blue" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Blue' theme.
"Office2k7Silver" - a theme that is compatible with MS Office 2007's 'Silver' theme.
"Onyx" - a theme that features black and orange highlights.
"Royale" - a theme that features subtle blue highlights.
"RoyaleStrong" - a theme that features strong blue highlights.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.NormalModeSettings.AllowTileSizing
member.summary: Gets/sets whether the user will be allowed to re-size tiles.

remarks.para: Note: the 'Synchronized' setting (the default) is ignored in maximized mode or if is set to 'UseExplicitRowColumnOnTile'. Also, if TileLayoutOrder is set to 'HorizontalVariable' only the synchronized height will be used. Likewise, if it is set to 'VerticalVaraible' only the synchronized width will be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.NormalModeSettings.ExplicitLayoutTileSizeBehavior
member.summary: Gets/sets whether tile heights are synchronized across columns and whether tile widths are synchronized across rows when is set to 'UseExplicitRowColumnOnTile'

remarks.para: If there are ColumnsSpan values specified > 1 on one or more tiles then all tiles in intersecting columns will behave as if this setting was 'SynchronizeTileWidthsAndHeights' with respect to all other tiles in those intersecting columns.

Likewise, if there are RowSpan values specified > 1 on one or more tiles then all tiles in intersecting rows will behave as if this setting was 'SynchronizeTileWidthsAndHeights' with respect to all other tiles in those intersecting rows.

Note: regardless of the value of this setting if the overall size is constrained (e.g. if the HorizontalTileAreaAlignment and/or VerticalTileAreaAlignment is set to 'Stretch') then resizing a tile's width may indirectly affect the width of all tiles and resizing its height may indirectly affect the height of all tiles respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.NormalModeSettings.MaxColumns
member.summary: Gets/sets the maximum number of columns to use when arranging tiles in 'Normal' mode..

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.NormalModeSettings.MaxRows
member.summary: Gets/sets the maximum number of rows to use when arranging tiles in 'Normal' mode..

remarks.para: Note: a value of zero, which is the default, represents unlimited.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.NormalModeSettings.MinColumns
member.summary: Gets/sets the minimum number of columns to use when arranging tiles in 'Normal' mode..

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.NormalModeSettings.MinRows
member.summary: Gets/sets the minimum number of rows to use when arranging tiles in 'Normal' mode..

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.NormalModeSettings.ShowAllTiles
member.summary: Gets/sets whether all tiles are arranged in view

remarks.para: Note: even if this property is set to true it is still possible that all the tiles don't fit, e.g. if there isn't enough space to satisfy their minimum size constraints. In this case, scrollbars will appear.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.NormalModeSettings.TileConstraints
member.summary: Gets/sets the constraints use for sizing a tile when it's is 'Normal'

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.NormalModeSettings.TileLayoutOrder
member.summary: Gets/sets how the panel will layout the tiles.

Likewise, if there are RowSpan values specified > 1 on one or more tiles then all tiles in intersecting rows will behave as if this setting was 'SynchronizeTileWidthsAndHeights' with respect to all other tiles in those intersecting rows.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.Tile
member.summary: A derived element that represents a tile inside a .

remarks.para: Note: even though this class derives from ContentControl it exposes all of the properties and functionality of a . The reason the class doesn't derive from HeaderedContentControl is because the base PrepareItemContainer logic in ItemsControl assumes that the item in the Items collection should be set as its Header, likewise the property should be set as the HeaderTemplate. For tiles this is not the intent, instead the item should be the Tile's Content and the ItemsControl.ItemTemplate property should be used to initialize the ContentTemplate property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.Tile.SerializationId
member.summary: Returns/sets a string that is stored to idenify the tile when the layout is saved.

remarks.p: The SerializationId property is not used by the Tile itself. Instead, the value of the property is saved along with the layout when using the method. This property can be used to save information that you can use to re-create an item when the layout is loaded if the associated tile is not already loaded thru the event. The SerializationId can be used to identify what type of content that you want to create. For example, this can be set to the name of the file so that you can load the file when the layout is loaded.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.AllowTileSizing
member.summary: Determines whether tiles can be resized.

remarks.para: Note: the 'Synchronized' setting (the default) is ignored in maximized mode or if is set to 'UseExplicitRowColumnOnTile'. Also, if TileLayoutOrder is set to 'HorizontalVariable' only the synchronized height will be used. Likewise, if it is set to 'VerticalVaraible' only the synchronized width will be used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.AllowTileSizing.Synchronized
member.summary: When one tile is resized, all tiles are resized to that same size. This is the default setting.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.AllowTileSizing.Individual
member.summary: Tiles can be resized independently of one another

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.AllowTileSizing.No
member.summary: Tiles can not be resized.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.MinimizedTileExpansionMode
member.summary: Determines how many tiles may be expanded in the when they are minimized

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.MinimizedTileExpansionMode.AllowOne
member.summary: Only one minimized tile can be expanded at any time (i.e. expanding another tile will restore the existing one's state to 'Minimized').

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.MinimizedTileExpansionMode.AllowMultiple
member.summary: Any number of minimized tiles can be expanded (i.e. in the 'MinimizedExpanded' state) and when a tile is initially shown in the minimized tile area its state will be 'Minimized'.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.MinimizedTileExpansionMode.AllowMultipleExpandAllInitially
member.summary: Any number of minimized tiles can be expanded (i.e. in the 'MinimizedExpanded' state) and when a tile is initially shown in the minimized tile area its state will be 'MinimizedExpanded'. This is the default setting.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.TileCloseAction.Default
member.summary: The default value which resolves to 'DoNothing'

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.TileCloseAction.DoNothing
member.summary: The can't be closed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.TileCloseAction.CollapseTile
member.summary: When the is closed its Visibility will be coerced to 'Collapsed' but the associated item will remain in the Items collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.TileCloseAction.RemoveItem
member.summary: When the is closed the associated item will be removed from the Items collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Windows.Tiles.TileBrushKeys
member.summary: Static class that exposes the resource keys used by the elements in the assembly.

remarks.para: These keys are referenced in the templates of the elements defined within the assembly via dynamic references. Therefore, the default brushes can be easily changed by defining replacement brushes, keyed with these keys, in resources anywhere within the resolution scope of their use.
Note: These brushes are normally added to the Resources collection of the window or the application.
